field_introduction.value:
Welcome to the Cambridge Audio online training module for Edge.

Five decades ago our founders had a vision – to create hi-fi systems that delivered the Great British sound into people’s homes. Nothing added, nothing taken away.

One of these talented engineers, Professor Gordon Edge, was the brains behind the innovation and design of our first product – the ground-breaking P40 integrated amplifier. In recognition of our heritage, we developed Edge.The embodiment of Cambridge Audio’s signature Great British Sound and the pinnacle of 50 years of Hi-Fi expertise.

During this module you will find out about some of the history of Cambridge Audio, our listening philosophy and the key technologies that drive Edge.

field_body.value: Some text to introduce Edge

The P40 Amplifier was the first amplifier in the world to use a toroidal transformer.

It sounded better than anything else, and launched to huge critical acclaim.

The P40 is just the first legacy that Cambridge Audio has left on the Hi-Fi industry.

field_body.value: This substantial-looking machine was the world’s first 2-box CD player. It comprised a lower deck that contained the decoder and analogue filter sections, and a larger upper deck that carried control, transport, and power-supply sections. Still today the CD1 is recognised as a landmark product in CD reproduction thanks to its unique design incorporating three DACs per channel and three power supply transformers.

Featuring BNC (Bayonet Neill–Concelman - a miniature quick connect/disconnect radio frequency connector used for coaxial cable) inputs and outputs, the DacMagic offered incredible performance at an extremely low price, making it the first product in Cambridge Audio’s history to win a prestigious “What Hi-Fi? Best Buy” award in 1996.

In 2011 we launched the NP30, Cambridge Audio’s first Network Music Player and established our award winning Stream Magic music streaming platform. Building on and adding to the success of this versatile platform, the Stream Magic 6 and Minx Xi players followed, cementing Cambridge Audio’s reputation as a leader in network music streaming technology.

field_correct_choice.value: The first amplifier to use a toroidal transformer

field_incorrect_choices.value: World’s first amplifier to use an external transformer

field_question.value: What was so innovative about the P40 Amplifier?

field_body.value:
Since 1968 Cambridge Audio has faithfully pursued the accurate representation of ‘British’ sound.

But what does British sound actually mean? Watch this short video to get to the bottom of it. Don’t forget to turn the sound up!

field_correct_choice.value: Unadulterated, unfiltered and as the producer first laid down

field_incorrect_choices.value: Mid-range mix to carry the vocals

field_question.value: Which of these statements best describes ‘Great British Sound’?
What year did Cambridge Audio start their pursuit of the 'British' sound?
What did Cambridge Audio create to deliver a pure British sound from digital music files?

field_body.value:
In the build-up to our 50th anniversary, we asked our engineers a simple question – what would they make if anything was possible?

Forget cost. Forget limitations. Create a system that delivers previously undiscovered layers of detail, is highly transparent, offering superlative sound-staging. A product true to Cambridge Audio’s foundations of creative innovation and entrepreneurial ambition.

Over 3 years in the making, utilising a team of 9 engineers, the result is Edge.

Edge A is made to celebrate musicality. Riffs, phrases, percussive rolls – take in every detail of your music thanks to its dynamic setup. Effortlessly powerful, but with incredible depth, the overall sound is breath-taking – like you’re sat in the recording booth with the musician themselves.

An integrated amplifier houses both preamplifier and power amplifier in one box. The Edge A has numerous connections , both digital and analogue as well as AptxHD Bluetooth.

With a revolutionary preamp circuit-board that reduces interference and an incredibly clean signal path, Edge NQ plays your favourite music with astonishing depth. Stream, cast, plug-in and play to enjoy every note in perfect clarity.

The job of a pre-amplifier is to control input selection and volume. The Edge NQ has inputs for all of your sources as well as being home to the very latest incarnation of our award-winning Streammagic streaming platfrom.

field_headline.value: EDGE NQ - PREAMPLIFIER WITH NETWORK PLAYER

field_body.value:
Edge W is made to be played loud. When you do turn it up, expect nothing but a dynamic and punchy sound that captures all the musicality of your songs. With just 14 hand-picked components, Edge W has one of the cleanest signal paths available. It delivers our breath-taking, unadulterated British sound – nothing added, nothing taken away.

A power amplifier takes the analogue signal from a preamplifier and uses it to drive the speakers. The Edge W provides the muscle to match the Edge NQ’s finesse.

field_question.value: The Edge A is....
When an Edge W is paired with an NQ, which unit controls the volume?
How many components are there in the Edge W’s signal path?

field_body.value:
A clean Alternating Current signal is key to delivering Great British Sound from the amplifier to the speakers. Direct Current generated in the amplification process can be detrimental to sound quality as it causes distortion.

In a conventional Hi-fi topology, DC is removed by using capacitors but these capacitors can significantly colour the final sound reproduction – not in line with our Great British Sound philosophy.

Edge uses a DC Servo to measure the amount of DC generated during amplification. The servo then applies an equal but opposite amount of DC. These two DC signals cancel each other out leaving pure unfiltered AC to drive the speakers.

field_incorrect_choices.value: Capacitors reduce modulation in an AC signal

field_question.value: Why doesn’t Edge use capacitors to eliminate Direct Current from it’s signal chain?

field_body.value:
The base for any piece of electrical equipment is the power supply.

Toroidal transformers have been found in Cambridge Audio products since our first amplifier, the P40, in 1968. The word toroidal means “shaped like a doughnut” and due to that shape, these transformers give off a greatly reduced electro magnetic field compared to other types of transformer.

Having said that, some electro magnetic interference can escape which is why we use a second transformer to not only share the power duties but , when carefully positioned, it will cancel out the EM field of the first, meaning less hum is audible. This short video explains in more detail.

field_question.value: The word Toroidal means...

field_body.value:
For pure sound quality it’s hard to beat a Class A powered amplifier. Unfortunately Class A is incredibly inefficient. As little as 15% of the power used is turned into sound. The rest is turned into heat which requires a huge heat sink to dissipate.

Unique to Cambridge Audio, our Class XA amplifier topology brings the benefits of Class A sound quality, but with improved efficiency and less heat. We add a bias voltage to a traditional Class AB design, thus shifting the crossover point to a position where the distortion is not audible to the human ear.

Unclear on amplification classes? Watch our short video to find out more.

field_question.value: Excess power generated by a Class A amplifier is turned into what?

field_body.value: Cambridge Audio’s award winning Streammagic platform comes to Edge with a significant update – Google Chromecast built-in. Tap on the logos to find out more.
Works seamlessly for Apple products connected to the same network and plays back files at CD quality 16/44.1

Like Spotify Connect, your content will stream from the cloud freeing up your phone or tablet. Unlike Spotify Connect, Chromecast is available across a wide variety of apps. Simply tap the cast logo and select your Edge NQ for playback resolutions up to 24/96.

Chromecast Built-in also offers the opportunity to add your Edge NQ to a multiroom set-up with other Chromecast enabled devices

Spotify is the biggest global streaming service with more than 50 million premium subscribers. Spotify Connect is a feature that allows premium subscribers to stream their music choices directly to compatible equipment straight from Spotify’s servers. No more drain on the battery or interrupting the music to take a phone call.

Spotify delivers 320kbps at "Extreme" quality
Unlike Spotify, Tidal is a streaming service that deals in CD quality streaming. Twice the price but the quality upgrade is definitely worth it. Resolution up to 16/44.1 is supported.

field_question.value: Google Chromecast is capable of audio playback at what resolution

field_body.value:
Both Edge A and NQ have a fully featured selection of digital and analogue inputs as well Bluetooth Aptx HD allowing you to get the most out of all your music sources.

Touch the images below to enlarge and investigate. You’ll notice that the inputs are also labelled upside down in addition to the correct way up because who hasn’t found themselves struggling to read whilst hunched over a piece of hi-fi equipment?

field_question.value: What does a Windows PC require to play music through the Edge’s Class 2 USB port?

field_body.value: The Dual Concentric Control Knob on Edge A and NQ serves two purposes – volume control and source selection. Made up of 31 individually machined parts, the knob is both designed and manufactured in the UK.
